verses.verse: Blessed<WH835> is he whose transgression<WH6588> is forgiven<WH5375>, whose sin<WH2401> is covered<WH3680>.
Blessed<WH835> is the man<WH120> unto whom the Lord<WH3068> imputes<WH2803> not iniquity<WH5771>, and in whose spirit<WH7307> there is no guile<WH7423>.
When I kept silence<WH2790>, my bones<WH6106> grew old<WH1086> through my roaring<WH7581> all the day long<WH3117>.
For day<WH3119> and night<WH3915> your hand<WH3027> was heavy<WH3513> upon me<WH3955>: my moisture is turned<WH2015> into the drought<WH2725> of summer<WH7019>. Selah<WH5542>.

I acknowledged<WH3045> my sin<WH2403> unto you<WH5771>, and my iniquity have I not hid<WH3680>. I said<WH559>, I will confess<WH3034> my transgressions<WH6588> unto the Lord<WH3068>; and you forgave<WH5375> the iniquity<WH5771> of my sin<WH2403>. Selah<WH5542>.

For this shall every one that is godly<WH2623> pray<WH6419> unto you in a time<WH6256> when you may be found<WH4672>: surely in the floods<WH7858> of great<WH7227> waters<WH4325> they shall not come near unto him<WH5060>.
You are my hiding place<WH5643>; you shall preserve<WH5341> me from trouble<WH6862>; you shall compass<WH5437> me about with songs<WH7438> of deliverance<WH6405>. Selah<WH5542>.
I will instruct<WH7919> you and teach<WH3384> you in the way<WH1870> which<WH2098> you shall go<WH3212>: I will guide<WH3289> you with my eye<WH5869>.

Be you not as the horse<WH5483>, or as the mule<WH6505>, which have no understanding<WH995>: whose mouth<WH5716> must be held<WH1102> in with bit<WH4964> and bridle<WH7448>, lest<WH1077> they come near unto you<WH7126>.
Many<WH7227> sorrows<WH4341> shall be to the wicked<WH7563>: but he that trusts<WH982> in the Lord<WH3068>, mercy<WH2617> shall compass him about<WH5437>.
Be glad<WH8055> in the Lord<WH3068>, and rejoice<WH1523>, you righteous<WH6662>: and shout<WH7442> for joy<WH3477>, all you that are upright in heart<WH3820>.
